metadata.title: CVE-2022-33967 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
squashfs filesystem implementation of U-Boot versions from v2020.10-rc2 to v2022.07-rc5 contains a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability due to a defect in the metadata reading process. Loading a specially crafted squashfs image may lead to a denial-of-service (DoS) condition or arbitrary code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-33967` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

u-boot - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-amlogic - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-exynos - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-imx - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-microchip - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-mvebu - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-omap - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-qcom - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-qemu - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-rockchip - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-rpi - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-sifive - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-stm32 - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-sunxi - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-tegra - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
u-boot-tools - 2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: u-boot package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2022.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4').
